meanings.definition: to tie or fasten together with knots
meanings.sent1: She interknots the shoelaces carefully before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: He always interknots the ropes securely before sailing.
meanings.sent3: The magician interknots the scarves to create a colorful illusion.
meanings.sent4: The vines interknot like a complex puzzle in the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The spider expertly interknots its web to catch prey.

meanings.definition: a tangled or twisted mass of knots
meanings.sent1: The old rope was a jumbled interknots of fibers.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to untangle the interknots in her necklace chain.
meanings.sent3: The interknots in the garden hose made watering the plants a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The interknots in the yarn created a unique pattern in the sweater.
meanings.sent5: The interknots in the fishing net trapped the fish inside.

meanings.definition: relating to or characterized by knots or entanglements
meanings.sent1: The interknots rope was difficult to unravel.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the interknots wires to prevent tripping.
meanings.sent3: The interknots situation at work required careful navigation.
meanings.sent4: His interknots thoughts kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The interknots branches created a natural barrier in the forest.
